Sentencas: The solid oxide electrolysis cell (SOEC) technology has a huge potential for future mass production of hydrogen, mainly due to its high electrical-to-chemical energy conversion efficiency.
Titulo: Operando observation of nickel/ceria electrode surfaces during intermediate temperature steam electrolysis

Sentencas: However, the durability and the performance of SOEC devices are inferior to that of other competitive electrolysis technologies inhibiting the commercialization of SOECs.
Titulo: Operando observation of nickel/ceria electrode surfaces during intermediate temperature steam electrolysis

Sentencas: Despite the fact that Ni-based cermets are currently the most widely used cathode materials for SOEC, change of the nickel oxidation state has been accused as a major issue limiting the performance of these devices.
Titulo: Operando observation of nickel/ceria electrode surfaces during intermediate temperature steam electrolysis

Sentencas: In this work we provide operando experimental evidence of the active surface oxidation state and composition of nickel/doped-ceria cermets under Water electrolysis conditions using ambient pressure X-ray photoelectron and near edge X-ray absorption fine structure spectroscopies, combined with quantitative spectra simulation.
Titulo: Operando observation of nickel/ceria electrode surfaces during intermediate temperature steam electrolysis

Sentencas: Remarkably under specific operational conditions, nickel is maintained in a partially oxidized state which, counterintuitive to the expected behavior, can be beneficial to the cell performance.
Titulo: Operando observation of nickel/ceria electrode surfaces during intermediate temperature steam electrolysis

Sentencas: This finding may initiate new improvement strategies for SOEC electrodes based on thorough optimization of the operational conditions, in order to engineer in situ the most propitious electrode configuration.
Titulo: Operando observation of nickel/ceria electrode surfaces during intermediate temperature steam electrolysis
